Scottish whaler bequeaths thousands of Kiwi descendants a potential genetic timebomb https://www.nzherald.co.nz/the-listener/health/scottish-whaler-bequeaths-thousands-of-kiwi-descendants-a-潜在-遗传-timebomb/EY57RRANFNAVVCXSNKZICRY4JQ/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/the-listener/health/scottish-whaler-bequeaths-thousands-of-kiwi-descendants-a-潜在-遗传-timebomb/EY57RRANFNAVVCXSNKZICRY4JQ/ Ruth BrownPart 1: Genetic data will revolutionise medicine. Here's how it's saving one Kiwi family. Sat, 16 Mar 2024 21:00:00 +0000 A Scottish whaler who settled in New Zealand in the 1840s passed down a gene variant that can be deadly for the carrier if they have to go under anaesthetic. It means his descendants are tested more rigorously before surgery requiring anaesthetic. Photo / Getty Images
